original_title: Report called for over sugar price increase: Siyambalapitiya
original_body_lines: A report has been called for from the Trade and Investment Policy Department over the sugar price increase in the market, State Minister of Finance Ranjith Siyambalapitiya said today.
He told Parliament that there was no reason for an increase in the price of sugar in a situation where the value of the Sri Lankan rupee has appreciated against the US Dollar.
The Minister also said that the price of wheat flour cannot be increased due to the new customs duty imposed on wheat flour.
"The US Dollar has depreciated against the rupee by 13 percent and the wheat flour in the world market has also gone down by 15 percent," he said.
Referring to the import of eggs, he said 4.5 million eggs have been imported to Sri Lanka from February 13, 2023 to date.(Ajith Siriweardana and Yohan Perera)
